div.p: Tothe California Farmer and Journal of Useful Sciences

note.p: Letter not found. The text given here is from 'Valuable botanical report', California farmer and journal of useful sciences, 24 December 1874, p. 180. The letter is dated to October 1874 as the latest likely date that it could have been sent to have been mentioned in this issue of the weekly newspaper. The same news item was inserted in the issue of 21 January 1875, p. 194.

div.p:
[We have been again most kindly favored by Professor
M was not styled 'Professor', and never held an appointment other than examiner at a universityor other teaching establishment.
von Mueller, Director of the Botanical Gardens, at Melbourne,
M ceased to be Director of the Gardens on 30 June 1873 (see C. Hodgkinson to M, 31 May 1873).
with his very able and full R eport s uponthe Botany ofthe great and rich region of Australla, embracing minute and valuable statistical and scientific information upon all matters touching this most interesting region, and the wonderful productions of that country, of these we shall speak in our New Volume.
M's 'Report of the Government Botanist for the year ending 30th June 1874'(B74.09.01)was printed in fullin the newspaper, in six instalments under the series title 'Valuable botanical researches,and reports of the Australian region',starting with B75.04.01.

We are also greatly indebted to Professor Mueller for rare and valuableSeeds and Plants, which we duly prize, andshall care for andreportupon, we musthere add that the great laborand research that has been given by Prof. Meuller to his works and thus sent forth to the world in his valuable publicationshas done much to awaken attention to Australia inher wealth of Agriculture and Horticulture, andher Botanical Wonders, and thus reflecting great and deserved honorsupon Professor Mueller also, as well as that country.]
